tool_description: FREE real time currency conversion and exchange rates updated every minute. Histrocial exchange rates available back to 1990. Over 160 currencies supported.
name: ExchangeRatesPro
title: ExchangeRatesPro

api_list.name: Historical Exchange Rates
api_list.description: Access over two decades of historical exchange rate data with the /historical endpoint. Exchange rates are provided as daily end of day exchange rates dating back all the way to 1999. Choose the day with the 'date' parameter.

api_list.name: Latest Exchange Rates
api_list.description: Get up-to-date exchange rate data with the /latest endpoint. Choose from daily, hourly, or minute updates, based on your plan. Stay on top of the markets with real-time data, delivered with one simple request.

optional_parameters.name: resolution
optional_parameters.description: Select the resolution of the latest exchange rates. 1m will update with new rates every minute, 1h ever hour and 1d every day.

optional_parameters.name: currencies
optional_parameters.description: Provide a comma separated list of the currencies you want exchange rates for. As default all currencies are returned. ( example: USD,EUR,AUD,GBP )

optional_parameters.name: base
optional_parameters.description: Change the base currency of the returned rates. USD by default.

api_list.name: List Available Currencies
api_list.description: Returns a list of all currencies that are available through the API.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://exchangeratespro.p.rapidapi.com/currencies"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "exchangeratespro.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://exchangeratespro.p.rapidapi.com/currencies"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "exchangeratespro.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
